title: FA audit logs
body: FA audit logs let you track user activities related to sensitive customer data and changes in preferences that can modify the business logic.

title: Customer information logs
body: FA records logging in and out, opening windows, making selections on Overview, searches, report generations, PDF and XLS exports. Each audit trail entry includes details about the user, time, and screen, and information the user accessed or exported.

title: Changes in system settings
body: FA tracks changes in system settings that can affect FA functionality and system logic.

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: FA Fund Management allows you to set up and use workflows that handle NAV calculation:

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: Regular NAV calculation workflow to calculate NAV and fees regularly, for example, every day.

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: Fee calculation workflow to calculate fees between the regular NAV calculation dates, in addition to the regular NAV calculation schedule.

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow to calculate NAV for reporting purposes between the scheduled NAV calculations.

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: For example, if you have a fund that calculates NAV once a month, you can still schedule unofficial fee updates once a week to get intermediate fees, and calculate unofficial NAV every day to stay on top of the progress. You would have separate schedules set on all of these.

title: Workflows and NAV statuses
body: Deferrals and NAV calculation workflow for funds with income distribution. This allows you to run deferral calculation in FA Fund management app and saves the bookkeeping postings before you calculate NAV.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Regular NAV calculation workflow is used for calculating NAV and fees for your fund regularly, for example, every day or every week. If NAV has to be calculated today, the fund has Pending NAV status. During the calculation, FA Fund Management performs pre-defined checks on your data and shows you warnings if there is something to pay attention to. You can view all NAV details in the NAV window. When you accept NAV, FA Fund Management:

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Updates the share class prices (see Market data info in FA BAck reference for details).

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Updates unit price for the incoming orders.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Generates NAV report and saves them in your fund portfolio’s documents.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Generates accrued fee transactions to the fund.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: If configured so, executes incoming trade orders using the calculated unit price and generates deposit and withdrawal transactions to the fund portfolio. Transactions are grouped per share class, settlement date, and type (subscription or redemption). For example, one transaction is generated for all share class A subscriptions with the same settlement date. For more details about generated transactions, see Questions about workflows and statuses.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: If configured so, updates fund security allocations in FA Back. FA analyses fund portfolio investments on the NAV date and updates the allocation structure on the fund security in FA Back for the NAV date.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: If your FA Fund management app is configured to run deferrals, and if you entered the accounting rules in fund settings (see Fund wizard), the system marks the postings that were used to calculate accrued income as "Reported".

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: The statuses of NAV calculation for the regular workflow are:

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: No action

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: No action needs to be taken today. All calculations are scheduled for the future.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: No schedule

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Calculation schedules for the fund aren’t set.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Pending NAV

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV needs to be calculated today. If you didn’t calculate NAV for the previous scheduled days, you need to calculate and accept these first to be able to calculate the current day’s NAV.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Calculated

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV was already calculated.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Warning

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV was calculated with warnings that might need your attention.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Rejected

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV calculation results were rejected by the user. NAV needs to be calculated again today.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Accepted

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV calculation result was accepted.

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: Error

title: Regular NAV calculation workflow
body: NAV calculation or acceptance failed because of the system error on the FA side (this is a rare situation). You can revert the changes and re-run the process – see NAV ( Roll back failed calculation and Roll back failed acceptance buttons).

title: Fee calculation workflow
body: You can set a separate schedule for calculating and accepting fees. The calculated fees are displayed in the NAV window.

title: Fee calculation workflow
body: The statuses for the fee calculation workflow are:

title: Fee calculation workflow
body: No action

title: Fee calculation workflow
body: No action needs to be taken today. All calculations are scheduled for the future.

title: Fee calculation workflow
body: Pending fees

title: Fee calculation workflow
body: Fees need to be calculated today. If you didn’t calculate fees for the previous scheduled days, you need to calculate and accept them first to be able to calculate the current day’s fees.

title: Fee calculation workflow
body: Fees calculated

title: Fee calculation workflow
body: Fees were already calculated today.

title: Fee calculation workflow
body: Warning

title: Fee calculation workflow
body: Fees were calculated today with warnings that might need your attention.

title: Fee calculation workflow
body: Fees rejected

title: Fee calculation workflow
body: Fee calculation result was rejected by the user. Fees need to be calculated again today.

title: Fee calculation workflow
body: Fees accepted

title: Fee calculation workflow
body: Fee calculation result was accepted.

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: You can schedule unofficial calculation of NAV and fees for your fund between the official dates. This workflow is for your information only. It allows you to follow NAV for your fund. Unofficial calculation doesn’t price share classes nor incoming orders. The calculation workflow is similar to the regular one, without the last acceptance step.

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: The statuses for unofficial NAV calculation workflow are:

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: No action

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: No action needs to be taken today. All calculations are scheduled for the future.

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: Pending unofficial NAV

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: Unofficial NAV needs to be calculated. If you didn’t calculate unofficial NAV for the previous days, you need to calculate these first to be able to calculate the current unofficial NAV.

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: Calculated unofficial NAV

title: Unofficial NAV calculation workflow
body: Unofficial NAV is already calculated. This status is shown only in the NAV window.

title: Deferrals and NAV calculation workflow
body: If you have deferral runs set up for your fund, FA Fund Management prompts you to run deferrals each time before you calculate NAV. A deferral run generates and saves bookkeeping postings for income distribution. Then, when you calculate NAV, FA calculates accrued income based on the generated postings. After running deferrals, the workflow is similar to the NAV calculation workflow.

title: Deferrals and NAV calculation workflow
body: In addition to the NAV calculation workflow statuses, this workflow has a Pending deferrals status which means that you need to run deferrals before calculating NAV.

title: Deferrals and NAV calculation workflow
body: Deferrals for a fund are set in the Fund wizard, Accounting tab (see Fund wizard). To learn more about deferrals, the Run deferrals section in FA User guide.

title: Non-scheduled calculations
body: You can calculate and accept NAV, fees, or unofficial NAV outside the schedule, if this is required by your business process. To turn on this feature, allow non-scheduled calculations in the Fund wizard, NAV schedules tab (see Fund wizard).

title: Questions about workflows and statuses
body: What happens if I forget to calculate or accept NAV?

title: Questions about workflows and statuses
body: FA Fund Management doesn’t let you skip scheduled calculations. So if you didn’t calculate or accept the pending NAV on the previous day, you have to do this on the current day before you calculate today’s NAV.

title: Questions about workflows and statuses
body: How can I set the transaction date and settlement date of client subscriptions and redemptions when I accept NAV?

title: Questions about workflows and statuses
body: The transaction date is automatically set to the NAV date (the date when NAV is accepted), so you can't change it.

title: Questions about workflows and statuses
body: The settlement date of a transaction is copied from the trade order. If no settlement date is specified in the trade order, FA defines it based on the Fund settings in FA Back. The fund settings let you set the default settlement date as "transaction date + N days" (by default, N=0 and transaction date is used as a settlement date).

title: Questions about workflows and statuses
body: My fund has unpaid subscriptions that are executed during NAV acceptance but I am unsure when the client will pay. How do I handle them?

title: Questions about workflows and statuses
body: To handle this case correctly, modify the trade order settlement date in FA Back. FA will generate separate transactions per trade order. You can specify the transaction type to use for such transactions (for example, “unpaid”) and manage these transactions separately.

title: Questions about workflows and statuses
body: My fund has an incoming trade order from an account in a different currency. How do I handle the exchange?

title: Questions about workflows and statuses
body: When you accept NAV, FA Fund management checks if the FX rate is set for the trade order. If the FX rate is missing, it adds the latest available FX rate in the trade order or transaction (if FA is configured to execute trade orders automatically when NAV is accepted).

title: Fund details pane
body: The Fund details pane on the right shows information about the fund selected from the list.

title: NAV settings and logs
body: NAV history button

title: NAV settings and logs
body: Opens the NAV window where you can view details of previous NAV calculations.

title: NAV settings and logs
body: Audit log button

title: NAV settings and logs
body: Opens the Audit logs window that shows the history of user actions and provides information about errors. The following user actions are logged:

title: NAV settings and logs
body: NAV calculation, deletion, acceptance, and rollback.

title: NAV settings and logs
body: Running deferrals.

title: NAV settings and logs
body: Fees calculation, acceptance, and rollback.

title: NAV settings and logs
body: NAV report generation.

title: NAV settings and logs
body: If something goes wrong, you will see a message that the action failed or was completed with errors. For more information, click the log entry and view the details on the right.

title: NAV settings and logs
body: Add share class button

title: NAV settings and logs
body: Opens the Share class wizard to create a share class for the fund.

title: NAV settings and logs
body: View in FA Back button

title: NAV settings and logs
body: Opens the fund portfolio, NAV, and fees calculation settings in FA Back.

title: NAV
body: NAV information shows NAV status, next NAV calculation date, who and when calculated and accepted the current NAV.

title: NAV
body: If the calculation or acceptance is in progress, you can see the buttons to interrupt it in case something goes wrong:

title: NAV
body: Stop calculation

title: NAV
body: Stop the NAV calculation and return to the Pending NAV status. The button is shown when the NAV calculation is in progress.

title: NAV
body: Stop acceptance

title: NAV
body: Stop the NAV acceptance. The button removes all changes made during the acceptance in FA Back, similar to rollback (see the rollback description in the NAV window) but keeps the latest NAV calculation. You can then recalculate NAV if needed.

title: NAV
body: The button is shown when the NAV acceptance is in progress.

title: NAV
body: Roll back failed calculation

title: NAV
body: Roll back NAV calculation that was interrupted due to a system error on the FA side. This is a rare situation indicated with the "Error" status (see Regular NAV calculation workflow). If you see the Error status, click the Roll back failed calculation button – the fund will return to the "Pending" status.

title: NAV
body: Roll back failed acceptance

title: NAV
body: Roll back NAV acceptance that failed due to a system error on the FA side. This is a rare situation indicated with the "Error" status (see Regular NAV calculation workflow). If you see the "Error" status, read the error message displayed in the list of funds (hover over the icon) – the message says at what stage the acceptance was interrupted. Open FA Back and remove the changes made during this step, if you find any (for example, you might need to delete the fee or cash transactions). Then, click the Roll back failed acceptance button – this will cancel all other acceptance steps.

title: NAV buttons
body: NAV buttons let you handle the NAV calculation and acceptance for the fund. To learn more about the process, see Workflows and NAV statuses. Depending on the NAV status, the available buttons are:

title: NAV buttons
body: Calculate NAV

title: NAV buttons
body: Start regular or unofficial NAV calculation for the fund. Available for funds with the Pending NAV, Pending unofficial NAV or Rejected NAV status.

title: NAV buttons
body: Calculate fees

title: NAV buttons
body: Start fee calculation for the fund. Available for the funds with the Pending fees status.

title: NAV buttons
body: Preview NAV

title: NAV buttons
body: Open the NAV window with the latest NAV calculation summary. You can also open this window by double-clicking the fund in the list.

title: NAV buttons
body: Accept NAV

title: NAV buttons
body: Accept the last calculated fees. Available for the funds with the Warning and Fees calculated status.

title: NAV buttons
body: Accept fees

title: NAV buttons
body: Accept the last calculated fees. Available for the funds with the Warning and Fees calculated status.

title: NAV buttons
body: Recalculate NAV

title: NAV buttons
body: Recalculate NAV after making any changes. Available for the funds in the Calculated or Warning status.

title: NAV buttons
body: Show status

title: NAV buttons
body: View the current NAV calculation or acceptance progress. The button is shown when the NAV calculation is ongoing.

title: Orders
body: Orders information shows outstanding trade orders per share class affecting the next NAV calculation.

title: Orders
body: Total count

title: Orders
body: Total number of outstanding trade orders on the fund level and for each share class. The number is based on the trade orders marked as executable in FA Back.

title: Orders
body: Total value

title: Orders
body: Value of outstanding trade orders. The calculation depends on how the trade order was entered in FA Back:

title: Orders
body: If the trade orders are based on the trade amount, Total value shows total net value. It is shown on the share class level, and also on the fund level, if all fund share classes are in the same currency.

title: Orders
body: If the trade orders are based on the number of units, Total value shows total number estimated with latest NAV:

title: Changes in system settings

title: Changes in system settings
body: Change preferences

title: Changes in system settings
body: Create, modify or delete Account set in Preference → Bookkeeping → Account set User [username] created/modified/deleted account set [account set code] Changes in JSON format. In case of creating or deleting an account set, all account set attributes and accounts are listed. Modification shows the change, the old values, and the new ones.

title: Changes in system settings
body: Modify Analytics+ columns in Preference → Content and translations → Analytics+ columns User [username] changed Analytics+ custom column definition for [custom column code] Changes in JSON format. In case of creating or deleting a column, all column attributes are listed. Modification shows the change, the old values, and the new ones.

title: Changes in system settings
body: Modify permissions in Preference → Administration → Permissions User [username] changed permissions: [permission change] Changes in JSON format: old permission set and the new one.

title: Changes in system settings
body: Create, modify or delete a posting rule in Preferences → Bookkeeping → Posting rules User [username] created/modified/deleted posting rule in rule set [ruleset code] id [rule ID] Changes in JSON format. In case of creating or deleting a posting rule, all posting rule attributes are listed. Modification shows the change, the old values, and the new ones.

title: Changes in system settings
body: Import a posting rule import in Preferences → Bookkeeping → Posting rules User [username] imported posting rules in rule set [rule set code] Changes in JSON format: all attributes of all rules in the imported file as one list.

title: Changes in system settings

In case of creating or deleting a security type, all security type attributes are listed. Modification shows the change, the old values, and the new ones.

In case of creating or deleting a configuration, all configuration attributes are listed. Modification shows the change, the old values, and the new ones.
